com.tsgrp.migration.event

Class JDBCContentReaderListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tsgrp.migration.event.AbstractListener
      • com.tsgrp.migration.event.JDBCContentReaderListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SourceEndExportNodeEventListener, TargetBeginImportNodeEventListener

    public class JDBCContentReaderListener
extends AbstractListener
implements SourceEndExportNodeEventListener, TargetBeginImportNodeEventListener
    Based on a configured query string, load content into the given node from the single column returned. Can be used as a post-export listener on the Source side or a pre-import listener on the Target side.

    MigrationNode Attributes Written

    • om_content_size (if setContentSizeOnNode is set)

    Data format types supported

    • BLOB (binary large object)

      void setInMemoryContentThreshold(int value)
      OPTIONALLY injected via Spring, defaults to 0; size (in bytes) under which content is stored in-memory as opposed to written to a temp file when the Connection cannot provide direct file store access.

      • setInMemoryContentThreshold

        public void setInMemoryContentThreshold(int value)
        OPTIONALLY injected via Spring, defaults to 0; size (in bytes) under which content is stored in-memory as opposed to written to a temp file when the Connection cannot provide direct file store access.
        Parameters:
        value -

      • setJdbcContentDataType

        public void setJdbcContentDataType(java.lang.String value)
        Injected, REQUIRED. Type of content to be extracted from a JDBC connection. Can be: BLOB, LOB, CLOB, RAW, LONG RAW... etc
        Parameters:
        value - String defining the type of content we will be extracting

      • init

        public void init()
        Must be called at startup in order to obtain JDBC Connection and to validate injectables are present. CALLED VIA SPRING USING init-method="init" on the bean's declaration tag.

      • loadContent

        protected void loadContent(MigrationNode node)
        Execute the provided query to obtain the current node's content from the database, which should be in the format data type specified in jdbcContentDataType.
        Parameters:
        node -
        setFolderAndName - if True, updated om_folder and om_name

      • getBlob

        protected java.sql.Blob getBlob(java.lang.String query)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Provide a query string that returns a single object, a blob object, that holds the content for the document specified by the query that was injected.
        Parameters:
        query - Query string that will return a single object that contains the content of the document specified in the query
        Returns:
        Blob object that holds the content of a document
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        This method will return a Content object given an InputStream.
